0.text: One: "You will be able to do many great things, but only if you get into someone's hand."
0.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>One: "You will be able to do many great things, but only if you get into someone's hand."</prosody></speak>

1.text: Two: "You will experience a painful sharpening from time to time, but you'll be better pencils once you are sharp."
1.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Two: "You will experience a painful sharpening from time to time, but you'll be better pencils once you are sharp."</prosody></speak>

2.text: Three: "You should be able to correct any mistakes that happen."
2.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Three: "You should be able to correct any mistakes that happen."</prosody></speak>

3.text: Four: "What's within you is more important than your outward appearance."
3.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Four: "What's within you is more important than your outward appearance."</prosody></speak>

4.text: Five: "Wherever you land, be sure to leave your mark. No matter what the condition is, you must continue with your duties." All the pencils agreed to take these into their hearts as they set out to the world.
4.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Five: "Wherever you land, be sure to leave your mark. No matter what the condition is, you must continue with your duties." All the pencils agreed to take these into their hearts as they set out to the world.</prosody></speak>

5.text: Answer the questions given below. 1. Where did the young man go to find food? 2. How did he become a good man? 3. What did the pencil maker want the pencils to remember? List them. 4. Find similar words for the following from the story:
5.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Answer the questions given below. 1. Where did the young man go to find food? 2. How did he become a good man? 3. What did the pencil maker want the pencils to remember? List them. 4. Find similar words for the following from the story:</prosody></speak>

7.text: 5. Find opposite words for the following from the above story. old - sad - outside - worst - wrong - bad - 6. Re-write these sentences replacing the underlined words with opposite words. 1. We might win the final race. 2. This man is very strong. 3. Krishna wears dark colours in the night. 4. Maheem remembers all his friends' birthdays. 5. Sarjoon was happy to hear that he had won a prize. 6. The competition will start early in the morning, this Sunday.
7.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>5. Find opposite words for the following from the above story. old - sad - outside - worst - wrong - bad - 6.
